title: Bitcoin ETF Inflows Hit Record $1 Billion in Single Day
summary: Spot Bitcoin ETFs saw unprecedented inflows as institutional interest continues to surge. BlackRock's IBIT led the pack with $500 million in daily inflows, followed by Fidelity's FBTC with $300 million. Analysts suggest this trend indicates growing mainstream adoption.
description: Spot Bitcoin ETFs saw unprecedented inflows as institutional interest continues to surge. BlackRock's IBIT led the pack with $500 million.
content: Spot Bitcoin ETFs saw unprecedented inflows as institutional interest continues to surge. BlackRock's IBIT led the pack with $500 million in daily inflows, followed by Fidelity's FBTC with $300 million. Analysts suggest this trend indicates growing mainstream adoption.
author: Michael Chen

title: Ethereum Layer 2 Networks Process More Transactions Than Mainnet
summary: Combined transaction volume on Arbitrum, Optimism, and Base now exceeds Ethereum mainnet, marking a significant milestone in scaling solutions. Layer 2 scaling solutions have reached a historic milestone as combined transaction volume now exceeds Ethereum mainnet.
description: Combined transaction volume on Arbitrum, Optimism, and Base now exceeds Ethereum mainnet, marking a significant milestone in scaling solutions.
content: Layer 2 scaling solutions have reached a historic milestone as combined transaction volume now exceeds Ethereum mainnet. This shift demonstrates the success of Ethereum's scaling roadmap and growing user adoption of L2 solutions.
author: Sarah Johnson

title: DeFi Total Value Locked Reaches $150 Billion
summary: Decentralized finance protocols have collectively locked $150 billion in assets, approaching previous all-time highs. The DeFi sector continues its recovery with total value locked reaching $150 billion across all protocols.
description: Decentralized finance protocols have collectively locked $150 billion in assets, approaching previous all-time highs.
content: The DeFi sector continues its recovery with total value locked reaching $150 billion across all protocols. Lending platforms and liquid staking derivatives lead the growth, with Lido, Aave, and MakerDAO dominating the market share.
author: Alex Turner
